articles.title: SJAA Officers
articles.summary: The San Jose Astronomical Association (SJAA) announced its January 1975 officers and a schedule of upcoming events. These include a general meeting featuring a Pioneer 10 report on Jupiter and the first star party at their new Mt. Umunhum observatory site, where attendees must sign a liability waiver. The article also recapped a December 1974 meeting discussing the new site's progress and telescope technology, and welcomed new members.

articles.title: ELEVATION 3,000 FT.
articles.summary: This document outlines directions and key features for the SJAA site, noting an elevation of 3,000 ft. It details the site entrance, which is approximately 1600 ft from a paved road along a dirt road, passing an owner's trailer and a warning sign with a cattle guard. The document also warns against approaching a nearby radar station.

articles.title: MT. UMUNHUM
articles.summary: Mount Umunhum is characterized by average wind speeds of 10-20 MPH, temperature extremes ranging from -10° to 110°, and an average annual snowfall of 3-4 feet. Reaching the summit takes approximately 25 minutes to cover 12 miles, with key surrounding roads including Hicks Rd and Blossom Hill Rd, connecting towards Los Gatos, and featuring a warning sign and cattle guard.
